item.title: Introducing the Library’s New Virtual Service Desk!
item.description: Need help but can’t make it to the library? Our Access Services team is now available online through the Virtual Service Desk seven days a week. Whether you’re looking for help searching for an item, accessing your library account to renew books, or reserving group study rooms, you can now chat directly with our staff in real time—no matter where you are. Get the same support you’d receive at the service desk, right from your laptop or phone.

item.title: Volunteer With Unity House of Troy!
item.description: The CCPD invites students to volunteer with Unity House of Troy as they prepare for their annual Thanksgiving Food Drive. This is a great opportunity to give back to our local community, support families in need, and represent RPI. Unity House is seeking volunteers on the following days: Friday, 11/21: 9AM-4PM, Monday, 11/24: 11AM–4PM, and Tuesday, 11/25: 9AM–12PM. Register in Handshake and email Dean Burke (burked5@rpi.edu) to indicate which date(s) and time(s) you are available to volunteer.

item.title: International Education Week (IEW) | Nov 17—21
item.description: IEW is an annual joint initiative of the U.S. Department of State and the U.S. Department of Education that promotes programs that prepare Americans for a global environment and attract future leaders from abroad to study, learn, and exchange experiences in the United States. It is an opportunity to celebrate and champion the benefits of international education and exchange worldwide. Please join Education Abroad/ISSS and our campus collaborators as we recognize this important week.

item.title: Presence, Play, and Collective Dreaming: Embodied Social Practice as Research with Jane Rigler
item.description: This interactive experience explores how engaged social practice can serve as a methodology for collective research and restorative community building. Through facilitated invitation, inspired by the work of Pauline Oliveros (musician, humanitarian, and founder of Deep Listening), participants explore presence and play, cultivating capacity for orientation to what is emerging in this moment. Join at EMPAC Studio Beta from 5-7pm on 11/19.

item.description: Join us for Title IX and Beyond, an informational session focused on understanding your rights, navigating personal and professional boundaries, and learning about reporting pathways at RPI and in the workplace. item.title: MMS Collaboration Software Training Series: RPI Digital Asset Management (DAM) System
item.description: Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, will present an overview of Rensselaer’s Digital Asset Management (DAM) System on Thursday November 20, from 11am-Noon.
